ResourceHeader.ResourceName: TIMED SEE Level2A EGS Solar Irradiance Data
ResourceHeader.Description: The EUV Grating Spectrograph (EGS) aboard SEE performs measurements of the Sun for about 3 minutes every orbit (97 minutes) which usually gives 14-15 measurements per day. The Level 2A data is time averaged over each measurement, after being 1-AU corrected and removing flares. The 1-AU correction is provided.

AccessURL.Name: SEE Data Products web page
AccessURL.Description: This web page allows the request of data files for this product. To request data: for the EGS_2A data type of interest, click the year of interest to go the the ftp directory of files and download the desired day-long file by clicking on it.

NumericalData.ProviderResourceName: SEE Level 2A EGS Solar Irradiance data

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file.

Parameter.Name: Wavelength intervals
Parameter.Description: Array of wavelength intervals, half-Angstrom centers

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.

Parameter.Name: EGS median solar irradiance
Parameter.Description: Array of median solar irradiances for each wavelength interval. This is the spectrum.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.

Parameter.Name: Median-averaged differences
Parameter.Description: Array of differences between the median and weighted averaged solar irradiances for each wavelength interval

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.

Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.

Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.

Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.

Parameter.Name: Number of points
Parameter.Description: Array of the Number of points (1-Angstrom-gridded measurements) used in determining the observation average for each wavelength interval

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.

Parameter.Name: Order sorting correction
Parameter.Description: Order Sorting correction applied to flux_median

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations, Number_of_wavelength_intervals] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file, and Number_of_wavelength_intervals is the number of wavelength intervals.
Dimensions: [Number_of_observations] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file.

Parameter.Name: Slit state
Parameter.Description: 0 is calibration slit, 1 is normal slit

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file.
Dimensions: [Number_of_observations] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file.
Dimensions: [Number_of_observations] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file.

Parameter.Name: Observation identifiers
Parameter.Description: Array of observation identifiers (1-254), A value of 0 means the observation did not produce data used in routine products.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file.

Parameter.Name: Flare ratio
Parameter.Description: Ratio of observation flux_median to daily flux_median

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [Number_of_observations] - where Number_of_observations is the number of observations in the file.
